Your suggestions:
Move all courses online 
Giving opportunity to students to drop courses anytime during the semester without affecting their transcript
More student interaction session 
I don't think 4 course rule for students to be considered full-time is fair.
Georgia Tech has pretty heavy courses and even when we create a balance by taking a combination of light-heavy courses it becomes too much. There isn't any learning there, nor does it help students do better later in life. This just creates unnecessary stress and anxiety. I would rather have 3 manageable courses are understand it properly compared to facing mental anxiety and stress just to survive it.
More on campus late night food options

lessen the assignments but encourage more research work for the graduate students
discussion of research topics every once in a while (monthly)
I wish there could be some centralize system which could sync the assignment submission date that no two or three assignments due on same day
I wish there could be open project or lab proposal session where student could propose their interested lab or project that which wish to work on (of course with verification from the Professors and TA),in lieu of assignments 
Existence of Heavy work load and CARE (which provides mental health service at GT) does seem that the management understands the relationship, but sad to see there is no solution they really address rather "you have to make it work".
